result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Roma A Hultgren was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (Passenger < 16 Yrs) (2+), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
IMPOSED & STAYED. If revoked, conditions of probation become conditions of extended supervision.
IID restriction effective upon licensure for 48 mo

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1449  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing & functioning IID. Not use or possess alcohol. Not be on the premises of any place or business whose primary business to sell alcohol. No alcohol in the residence where she resides.
Sobrietor for 6 mo upon release from jail. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Crt found Def was not required to participate in OWI Treatment Court.

records.addlTxt: Ct ordered zero restitution
Associated with Charge #1

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Dennis Burke
Status conference on March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
